{"step_by_step_thinking": "The empty thecal sac sign is a radiological sign seen on MRI of the spine, where the thecal sac appears empty due to clumping or absence of nerve roots. This is typically seen in arachnoiditis, a condition where the arachnoid mater of the spinal cord is inflamed. Tethered cord syndrome, vertebral osteomyelitis, and discitis do not typically present with this sign.", "answer_choice": "A"}
